page.title: 19Bourtie Cooperation
page.content: Many small farms in Bourtie do not eced 200 acres and are family-run concerns, where farther and son work together on the yearly routine. But at times like sowing, when greateer manpower is required over a short time, farmers on adjoining farms help each other get the work done. Larger equipment is used in etter growing areas like the Garioch, the so-called girnal (grainstoe) of Aberdeenshire, but in Bourtie three men can combine machine power to sow their neighbour's grain. At silage-cutting in June, the combined cutting equipment of two frms works alongside in one 10 acre field while grass sprouts into collectin bins.
